content.text: Learn how to create a tabbed image gallery with CSS and JavaScript.
content.html: Learn how to create a tabbed image gallery with CSS and JavaScript.

content.text: Click on an image to expand it:
content.html: Click on an image to expand it:

content.code: ×
content.code_html:
<!-- The grid: four columns -->
<div class="row">
  <div class="column">
    <img src="img_nature.jpg" alt="Nature" onclick="myFunction(this);">
  </div>
  <div class="column">
    <img src="img_snow.jpg" alt="Snow" onclick="myFunction(this);">
  </div>
  <div class="column">
    <img src="img_mountains.jpg" alt="Mountains" onclick="myFunction(this);">
  </div>
  <div class="column">
    <img src="img_lights.jpg" alt="Lights" onclick="myFunction(this);">
  </div>
</div>

<!-- The expanding image container -->
<div class="container">
  <!-- Close the image -->
  <span onclick="this.parentElement.style.display='none'" class="closebtn">×</span>

  <!-- Expanded image -->
  <img id="expandedImg" style="width:100%">

  <!-- Image text -->
  <div id="imgtext"></div>
</div>

content.text: Use images to expand the specific image. The image that is clicked on inside the column, is shown in a container below the columns.
content.html: Use images to expand the specific image. The image that is clicked on inside the column, is shown in a container below the columns.

content.text: Create four columns and style the images:
content.html: Create four columns and style the images:

syntaxHighlighting.text: /* The grid: Four equal columns that floats next to each other */

/* Style the 
  images inside the grid */

/* The expanding image 
  container (positioning is needed to position the close button and the text) */

position: absolute;  top: 10px;  
  right: 15px;  color: white;  font-size: 35px;  cursor: pointer;

/* Style the 
  images inside the grid */

/* The expanding image

position: absolute;  top: 10px;

content.code_html:
/* The grid: Four equal columns that floats next to each other */
.column {
  float: left;
  width: 25%;
  padding: 10px;
}

/* Style the images inside the grid */
.column img {
  opacity: 0.8;
  cursor: pointer;
}

.column img:hover {
  opacity: 1;
}

/* Clear floats after the columns */
.row:after {
  content: "";
  display: table;
  clear: both;
}

/* The expanding image container (positioning is needed to position the close button and the text) */
.container {
  position: relative;
  display: none;
}

/* Expanding image text */
#imgtext {
  position: absolute;
  bottom: 15px;
  left: 15px;
  color: white;
  font-size: 20px;
}

/* Closable button inside the image */
.closebtn {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 15px;
  color: white;
  font-size: 35px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text: /* The grid: Four equal columns that floats next to each other */

/* Style the 
  images inside the grid */

/* The expanding image 
  container (positioning is needed to position the close button and the text) */

position: absolute;  top: 10px;

syntaxHighlighting.text:
function myFunction(imgs) {  // Get the expanded image  var 
  expandImg = document.getElementById("expandedImg");  // Get the image 
  text  var imgText = document.getElementById("imgtext");  // 
  Use the same src in the expanded image as the image being clicked on from the 
  grid  expandImg.src = imgs.src;  // Use the value of the alt 
  attribute of the clickable image as text inside the expanded image  
  imgText.innerHTML = imgs.alt;  // Show the container element (hidden with 
  CSS)  
  expandImg.parentElement.style.display = "block";}

// Use the value of the alt 
  attribute of the clickable image as text inside the expanded image

// Show the container element (hidden with 
  CSS)

  expandImg = document.getElementById("expandedImg");  // Get the image 
  text  var imgText = document.getElementById("imgtext");  // 
  Use the same src in the expanded image as the image being clicked on from the

content.code_html:
function myFunction(imgs) {
  // Get the expanded image
  var expandImg = document.getElementById("expandedImg");
  // Get the image text
  var imgText = document.getElementById("imgtext");
  // Use the same src in the expanded image as the image being clicked on from the grid
  expandImg.src = imgs.src;
  // Use the value of the alt attribute of the clickable image as text inside the expanded image
  imgText.innerHTML = imgs.alt;
  // Show the container element (hidden with CSS)
  expandImg.parentElement.style.display = "block";
}

  attribute of the clickable image as text inside the expanded image
